href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;6a33c110.1503">Pensions and Pension Policy after the Recent Financial Crisis </a></description> <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;4975d03c.1503">   <title>Leicester Graduate Teaching Assistantships and Graduate Research Assistantships </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;4975d03c.1503</link>   <description> dear Colleagues,<br><br>the Department of Economics at the University of Leicester has several fully funded (4 year) GTAs and GRAs to fill for new PhD students starting September 2015. I would be very grateful if you could encourage your good undergraduates to apply. More information is available in the attached poster or at &lt;http://www2.le.ac.uk/study/research/phd/economics&gt;. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T11:05:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daniel Zizzo</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;4975d03c.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;372c2d13.1503">   <title>Use of Journal Rankings </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;372c2d13.1503</link>   <description> Dear All<br><br>CHUDE is aware that senior management in a number of universities may pressurise colleagues, particularly where in business schools, to rely on the ABS/EAJG ranking.<br><br>Following an action point from the CHUDE Steering Committee and the last CHUDE Full Meeting, and long-standing policy, this email is to confirm that neither the Conference of Heads of University Departments of Economics nor the Royal Economic Society endorse any journal ranking (whether the ABS/EAJG ranking or indeed any other ranking). [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-01T09:17:39+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daniel Zizzo</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;372c2d13.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;c4fa6dc0.1503">   <title>REF Questions and next CHUDE Full Meeting - Manchester, March 30 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;c4fa6dc0.1503</link>   <description> Dear All<br><br>The next CHUDE Full Meeting will take place on the first day of the Royal Economic Society conference at the University of Manchester, and specifically on Monday March 30, 10:30 AM refreshments for 11 AM start and end no later than 1 PM, with lunch available afterwards. The room will be University Place Room 5.204. University Place is building 37 on the following campus map: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-01T09:05:25+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daniel Zizzo</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;c4fa6dc0.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;f0260d3d.1502">   <title>FW: Bank of England One Bank Research Agenda and Discussion Paper </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;f0260d3d.1502</link>   <description> From: Price, Simon [mailto:Simon.Price@bankofengland.co.uk]<br>Sent: 26 February 2015 16:05<br>To: Daniel Zizzo<br>Cc: Nixon, Dan<br>Subject: Bank of England One Bank Research Agenda and Discussion Paper<br><br>Daniel,<br>I would be grateful if this email could be forwarded to your CHUDE list.<br><br>The Bank of England is one of only a handful of institutions in the world that are responsible for all of monetary, macroprudential and microprudential policy. All of these areas raise big questions, not least of which is the interaction between them. Conventional thinking about these policies has been challenged by the financial crisis. New policies and interventions have [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-26T16:14:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daniel Zizzo</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;f0260d3d.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;ea865abd.1502">   <title>FW: ESRC Studentships at Edinburgh </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;ea865abd.1502</link>   <description> -----Original Message-----<br>From: Tim Worrall [mailto:tworrall@exseed.ed.ac.uk]<br>Sent: 16 February 2015 16:22<br>To: Daniel Zizzo<br>Subject: ESRC Studentships at Edinburgh<br><br>Dear Daniel, could you forward to the CHUDE list please. Kind regards, Tim.<br>-----<br>Dear Colleague,<br><br>The School of Economics at the University of Edinburgh is offering up to six PhD studentships in the area of Credit and Labour Market Foundations of the Macroeconomy. The School is looking for high quality students who have, or will have by September, a distinction in a UK masters in economics or the equivalent. A flyer with information is attached. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-17T07:21:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daniel Zizzo</dc:creator> countries: identifying bottlenecks and obstacles to productive investments and technology adoption&lt;http://www.ifs.org.uk/events/1100&gt;<br><br>8 and 9 July 2015, Goodenough College London.<br><br>Organised by: Orazio Attanasio (UCL and IFS), Britta Augsburg (IFS), Safija Jusupovic (IFS) and Sonya Krutikova (IFS)<br><br>CALL FOR PAPERS NOW OPEN<br><br>The call for papers is now open and will close of 28th of February 2015 and notifications of acceptances will be circulated by April 17th 2015. I’d be grateful if you could let your PhD students know about this and encourage them to apply.<br>All the information you/they need can be found at https://www.bankofenglandgraduates.co.uk/our-programmes/.<br>If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to ask me. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-19T11:12:36+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daniel Zizzo</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;39ede3be.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;5eda944d.1501">   <title>FW: Warwick Economic Summer Workshop </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;5eda944d.1501</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;5eda944d.1501">FW: Warwick Economic Summer Workshop </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-01-16T07:54:52+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daniel Zizzo</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;5eda944d.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;466f3c9c.1501">   <title>Economics Network Reminders </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHUDE;466f3c9c.1501</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>I hope this finds you well. Just a reminder of some of our upcoming events in 2015. Please circulate within your departments.<br><br>New Lecturers Workshop &amp; Early Careers Symposium<br>University of Bristol, 16-17 April 2015<br><br>An interactive two day event for new lecturers focused on effective and innovative economics teaching.<br><br>The first day is intended exclusively for lecturers who have recently been employed in an economics (or related) department. The second day is also open to graduate teaching assistants.
